page.title: 10Staxigoe W.R.I.
page.content: The Staxigoe W.R.I. has been running in Staxigoe for many years. At present there are about 25 members who meet in the local hall on the second Tuesday of every month. They have a President, Vice President, Secretary and Treasurer. Each year they organise a trip and try to visit as many different places as possible. At the last meeting a lady came and showed the members how to make bread in different shapes and with various ingredients. She had taken butter and jam with her to spread on the bread so that everyone could get a taste. The W.R.I. normally has competitions. Last month the juniors had to bake 4 meringues and the seniors had to bake a savoury flan. They have craft competitions as well. After the demonstrator left they had a break and a business meeting.
